description: Combines online Numbas exercises (best 6 of 9 scores) and tutorial participation. Includes problem-solving practice and collaborative group work with immediate feedback.
Three-stage process involving draft submission, peer review, and final submission. Focuses on constructing rigorous mathematical proofs and communication skills using typesetting tools.
2-hour supervised exam via Mobius, covering all course topics. Includes multiple-part questions requiring proofs, explanations, and problem-solving under timed conditions.
Timed Numbas test in Week 4 assessing foundational concepts with practice attempts available. Conducted under supervised lab conditions.
Timed Numbas test in Week 10 assessing advanced concepts. Includes bonus attempts for eligible students with capped scores.
